results.title: Ten million strong
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John S. Gray
results.brief_description: Shows the different ways of life of the various racial groups in Malaysia, and demonstrates that Malaysia is divided more by the contrast between rich and poor than by racial prejudice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John S. Gray

results.title: Ten million books: an introduction to Farley Mowat
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Andy Thomson and Robert Verrall
results.brief_description: Farley Mowat has sold more books than any other Canadian writer - ten million copies in fifty countries and in twenty-two languages. In this film Mowat recalls some of his experiences that have found their way into the pages of his books. Selected readings from such stories as The Dog Who Wouldn’t Be and People of the North bring his eloquent, subjective non-fiction to life. (An abridged version of In Search of Farley Mowat).

results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Andy Thomson and Robert Verrall

results.title: Ten days that shook the world = October = Oktyabr (TEFC) [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Sovkino of Moscow, Sergei Eisenstein and Grigori Alekandrov
results.brief_description: A historical re-enactment of the ten days in October 1918 when the Russian Kerensky regime was toppled by the Bolsheviks.

results.title: Ten days that shook the world
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions, Filmske Novosti, Grigori Alexandrov and Norman Swallow
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of many of the historic events of the 1917 Russian Revolution on the locations where they actually happened. Men and women personally involved in the Revolution talk about what happened to them in those dramatic ten days. The producers had access to official Soviet files, film archives and libraries. Some of the newsreel material has not been seen before. Narration is by Orson Welles, supported by the voices of Robert Stephens, Barbara Jefford, Janet Suzman and Hugh Burden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Granada International Productions, Filmske Novosti, Grigori Alexandrov and Norman Swallow

results.title: Ten days that shook the Commonwealth
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”
This is the first of a series examining the Commonwealth of Nations to see what it really is - what the bonds are that unite, and the differences that divide, this great family scattered over the face of the Earth. Edgar McInnis, president of the Canadian Institute of International Affairs and narrator of the series, discusses relationships between individual members of the Commonwealth and how these relationships withstood the strains of the Suez crisis in 1956.

results.title: Ten commandments of love
results.brief_description: A photographic still image of two people in an impassioned embrace on an ocean pier. Harvey and the Moonglows start singing ‘The ten commandments of love’ to a background of changing color.
